adjective.description: British slang. Incapacitated by drugs or alcohol (or their after-effects); extremely intoxicated.

origin: Late 16th century (in an earlier sense). Originally from cabbage + -ed. In later use in sense 1 probably also partly from cabbage + -ed<br>early 18th century; earliest use found in Charles Coffey (d. 1745), writer. From cabbage + -ed.
